alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar rainfall estimates indicate that 2.5 to 4 inches of rain has fallen across an area between Savannah and the Savannah Airport, and near the Hunter Army Air Field. Broadcast media and public reports indicate that numerous roads are flooded, some have been closed. High tide will peak around 7 PM, resulting in the slow drainage of storm water early this evening. - Light to moderate rainfall will continue over the area through 730 PM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Hunter Army Airfield, Downtown Savannah, Windsor Forest, Midtown Savannah, Coffee Bluff, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Savannah International Airport, Montgomery, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Thunderbolt, Vernonburg, White Bluff, Savannah Historic District, Sandfly, Isle Of Hope, Whitemarsh Island and Skidaway Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
